text: Hi everyone!
:wave: Hi everyone! I am new to HubSpot. I just want to know what programming language should I have experience in it to be able to understand HubSpot for Developer.

Hello everyone :wave:, I'm creating a HubSpot app using node js. But I'm confused in storing of access_tokens and refresh_tokens. Because HubSpot doesn't return any information related to portal. In future, App will be used in multiple accounts. Can any one help me out in this?
As CMS developer, You should have knowledge of only HTML, CSS and Basic Javascript.
What about python?

Hey everyone :wave: Not sure on which channel i should post this so ill post it here. I have my HubSpot + shopify integration set up and all of the products i add on shopify will show up on HubSpot product library. I would like to have a module on my HubSpot website that would display all the newest products added to shopify on my HubSpot site automaticly, so that i wouldnt have to update them on both sides. Does anyone know if this is possible with HubDB maybe?  Or any other method?
have you tried the CRM- Object Field?
Some Jinja2 knowledge may be helpful, but definitely isn’t necessary.
Python is not required for CMS... If you wanted to work with CRM and Automation related stuff you can use it.
Yes both for CMS and CRM
Is there any mechanism in HubSpot to make a form unavailable after `x`  number of submissions?

the one way I can think of now is creating a custom object record each time a form is submitted and then using GraphQL to show either the form or something else based on the number of records that exist
I can think of a few ways using either Ops Hub or Serverless Functions, but nothing built-in as far as I know.
if using serverless functions I could check the size of a list or something?
or check the number of submissions directly? (not all that familiar with the available API) <@U26BLKGE4>

Looks like the v3 forms API either doesn’t yet support or is dropping the “form submissions” endpoint from v1, but you should be safe to use this one and I think it would be the most convenient: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/get-submissions-for-a-form>

Otherwise, I would think you would be able to use the contact search API to get how many contacts have submitted the form, but I’m not 100% sure. If it’s a new form, you could set up a workflow or use a hidden field to populate a contact property that could be used for reference via the search API.
<@U26BLKGE4> thanks, I appreciate the info/insight
always happy to help man

Does anyone have a good resource for HubSpot's IP Addresses that they use to host CMS or Landing Pages? Please Note: NOT email sending IP's. I need to whitelist IP's specifically for CMS and/or Marketing hosted pages, etc. Thanks!

Thanks for pointing this out, <@UGDF9EBPW>!
We made an update and this should be wokring now.  Let us know if you see differently!
You're the best!
no you are

Hi everyone, today we noticed that some dynamic pages are pointing to the gallery instead of the product page. And it works again only after changing the path url and then returning to the correct one.

Strange behavior that never occurred. We have 25+ sites generating dynamic pages and this is the first time I've seen some of the internal links display the "main page" instead of the internal one, requiring an update to get it working again.

Has anyone else noticed or had issues with dynamic Hub pages today?
AFAIK this is not possible, since HS is a distributed platform that scales up and down automatically. Could be wrong tho.
Mark is spot on
